attributes.action: Charging children born in the UK £936 to register as a British Citizen
attributes.additional_details:
Home Office Master Fees Leaflet 2016-03-08( B(OTA), B(OS) EM MN1, S2 S3T)

Child under 18 applying to register as a British citizen pay £936.
**An additional £80 per applicant is required to cover the ceremony fee should the child turn 18 during the application process. This will be required at point of decision.
attributes.background: Children born in the UK whilst their parents hadn't been granted settlement at the time of their birth have to pay £936 to register as a British Citizen is against their fundamental human right. Some parents with three children pay about £2,808 which is heart aching.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call for a clear action from the UK Government and Parliament. Your petition does not state what action you would like the Government to take. If you would like the Government to stop these charges, you could start a petition calling for that.
